result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan W. Zima was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan W. Zima

records.addlTxt: Called dispatch and spoke to N.N, warrant canceled on 10-25-22 at 9:03AM.

Copy to LCSD on 10/11/2022
Copy mailed to Def on 10/11/2022
On def's failure to pay the fine, Court orders 10 days jail.

10:19 AM in Room 301. Defendant Ryan W. Zima in court with attorney Daniel Craig Musser, both by Zoom. Defendant Ryan W. Zima in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person. 22CM31 and 21CM5. Attny Musser is appearing only on 22CM31; Def. does not have counsel on 21CM5. Global resolution offered to conclude both cases. Def. wants to waive counsel on 21CM5. Def. can hear, understands and consents to proceeding by Zoom. State recites joint agreement. On 22CM31 Def. to plead  to Ct. 1. Ct. 2 to be DRI.  Joint recommendation: 45 days jail, costs. Time served disposition.   21CM5 - DEJ on Ct. 1. State has filed motion to revoke, will ask to proceed to sentence; recommends withheld sentence, 1 year probation, costs, AODA and followthru, maintain abs. sob., complete mental health evaluation and followthru, no possession of any dangerous weapons, no contact with individuals as named on record, maintain fulltime work and any counseling as deemed necessary by agent. Attny Musser in agreement. Def. agrees with terms. Waiver of attorney reviewed for 212CM5. Court finds that Def. has waived right to attny on 21CM5; finds Def. competent and will allow Def. to represent self on 21CM5. Plea questionnaire reviewed on 22CM31.   
22CM31 - Def. pleads to Ct. 1 - Disorderly conduct, guilty. The Court grants State's motion to DRI Ct. 2.  Constitutional rights, elements and possible penalties reviewed. Attny Musser is satisfied. The Court finds Def. understands and that plea is freely and voluntarily given. The Court finds there is a factual basis, accepts plea and finds Def. guilty of Ct. 1 in 22CM31. Def. agrees there was a violation of DEJ. Sentencing remarks by State. State has complied with victim rights. Court requests clarification from State as to recommendation. Sentencing remarks by Attny Musser. Def. has nothing to say. Remarks by the Court. 
The Court will abide by agreement, orders
22CM31 - Ct. 1 - 45 days jail, Huber, credit for 39 days,  costs including DNA surcharge, DNA sample unless already provided. 
21CM5 -  Ct. 1 withheld sentence, 1 year probation, costs only including DNA surcharge, DNA sample unless already provided, AODA and followthru with any recommendations, maintain absolute sobriety, complete mental health evaluation and treatment at discretion of agent, no possession of dangerous weapons, no contact with Buddy or Kegan Krause, maintain fulltime employment/school 30  hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, participate in any counseling as deemed beneficial by agent.
Credit: 4 days on 21CM5. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
22CM31 - Costs to be paid in full within 24 hours or payment plan. Post conviction rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.

No contact with alleged victim or alleged victim residence.
No use of possession of dangerous weapons.
Take all medication as prescribed and only as prescribed.

01:22 PM Defendant Ryan W. Zima in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ryan W. Zima appeared by video means.  All parties via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. would like to represent himself. Court will allow def. to represent himself.  Not Guilty plea. Court receives Not Guilty plea.  State gives bail/bond recommendation.  Def. makes statement. Court orders $300.00 cash with conditions.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
